title: ContractNLI: A Dataset for Document-level Natural Language Inference for Contracts
problem: Contract review is time-consuming and expensive, creating barriers for smaller entities
prior_assumptions: Legal AI focused on extraction tasks rather than understanding and inference
insight: Document-level NLI can automate contract review by classifying hypotheses as entailed/contradicted/not mentioned
technical_approach: Multi-task learning with evidence identification, sophisticated context segmentation
evaluation: 607 annotated NDAs with 17 hypotheses, evidence spans marked by experts
impact: First dataset for document-level legal NLI, enables automated contract review
relevance: Provides framework for comprehension-based evaluation rather than extraction

title: ACORD: An Expert-Annotated Retrieval Dataset for Legal Contract Drafting
problem: Contract drafting relies on finding relevant precedent clauses, but no benchmarks exist
prior_assumptions: LLMs can generate contracts from scratch effectively
insight: Contract drafting is fundamentally clause retrieval and adaptation from precedents
technical_approach: 114 queries, 126K+ query-clause pairs ranked 1-5 stars by experts
evaluation: Bi-encoder retrieval with LLM re-ranking on complex commercial clauses
impact: First expert-annotated benchmark for contract clause retrieval
relevance: Demonstrates precedent-based legal work and expert annotation importance

title: What to Read in a Contract? Party-Specific Summarization of Legal Obligations, Entitlements, and Prohibitions
problem: Contracts are lengthy and domain-specific, parties need to understand specific obligations
prior_assumptions: Generic summarization approaches work for legal contracts
insight: Contract summarization should be party-specific, focusing on obligations/entitlements/prohibitions
technical_approach: Two-module system: content categorizer + importance ranker, 293K expert pairwise comparisons
evaluation: Human evaluation on lease agreements with party-specific analysis
impact: First party-specific legal summarization dataset with expert annotations
relevance: Validates party-specific approach and expert annotation for legal comprehension

title: TermSight: Making Service Contracts Approachable
problem: Terms of service are legally binding but filled with complex terminology
prior_assumptions: Making legal documents accessible requires only text simplification
insight: Multi-modal AI interfaces with visual summaries and contextualized definitions improve accessibility
technical_approach: Visual summaries, categorization, contextualized definitions in intelligent reading interface
evaluation: Within-subjects study (N=20) measuring reading difficulty and willingness
impact: Measurable improvements in legal document accessibility and user engagement
relevance: Demonstrates multi-modal approach to consumer legal document accessibility

title: Terminators: Terms of Service Parsing and Auditing Agents
problem: ToS documents are lengthy and complex, traditional approaches lack transparency
prior_assumptions: ToS understanding is a black-box summarization problem
insight: Structured, interpretable workflows (extraction, verification, accountability) enhance auditability
technical_approach: Modular agentic framework with specialized agents for different analysis tasks
evaluation: Demonstrated on OpenAI ToS, focus on auditability and transparency
impact: Enables transparent legal AI and automated policy audits
relevance: Shows promise of agentic approaches and structured legal document analysis
